Description: You need to be able to navigate to and use all the content with a keyboard, not just the mouse

If your tool or content uses the keyboard and the user can navigate to it with the keyboard then there must be a way to navigate away from it with the keyboard. The Escape key is typically used in many cases to jump away from certain content, but interfaces vary and that is ok
A keyboard shortcut with only one letter needs to be able to either be turned off, remapped, or be active only when that user interface component that uses it is active and has focus
Content that is timed and less than 20 hours long needs to be able to be turned off or adjustable
Content that moves, blinks, scrolls, or auto-updates needs to be adjustable
Avoid flashing content that flashes more than 3 times a second
Content that repeats itself can be skipped
Web pages should have a title
The order of focus on a web page can matter and should preserve meaning
The purpose of a link should be clear from the link itself
Functionality that uses a pointer should use the up event, not the down event and should be cancellable
If using an image of text as a label the text pictured should be in the name of the image
Unless essential there should be an alternative to motion for actuation. (e.g., instead of requiring the motion of the device provide a button as an alternative)
